WRITING.TEXT: Welcome to the Takedown meta my friend. Personally, I'm putting this game aside until the patch it again. My record has taken a beating this season and I can't be bothered with continually getting driven to the cage and taken down.
Maybe he won two rounds and you won one? Therefore he wins the fight?

WRITING.TITLE: The push/shove is probably the most underused tool in this game...

WRITING.TEXT: Don't play Ranked just yet. It will do your mental health no good.

Hold Right Trigger and then the input for the lead uppercut. PS = R2 (hold) + Square + X Xbox = RT (hold) + A + X For me it's so useful for creating space and keeping aggressive fighters away from me. I don't see it used often if at all online. #8203;
I always back out in the lobby if the bars are red or keeping shifting to red. Lag plays to bigger of a role in this game to soldier through it.
You've obviously never played FIFA.
... and he just stood there and ate it?

Khabib players who know how to play Khabib properly are the worst. I just quit out as soon as I realise that this Khabib player knows what he's doing on the ground as it's pretty much game over or your stamina is completely done when you stand up.

WRITING.TITLE: Full steam ahead with the casual/arcade route.
WRITING.TEXT: This post is just about the presentation. Gameplay wise, it's different but will take some time to get used to. I am however highly disappointed by ground game's "rework" - it screams lazy in my opinion. It needed a thorough rework. \-- The people at the top don't know this game's audience at all. Highly disappointing. 1. Tekken / Street Fighter-esque fighter selection. 2. Star ratings for each fighter to dumb it down for kids under 10 years old. 3. Mortal Kombat face offs once the fighter has been selected. 4. Bruce yelling once both fighters have been confirmed. Lol, why? 5. Taunts when being simply asked by Herb if "you're ready?"... The taunts will no doubt be micro-transactions to purchase. 6. Flashing red graphics when rocked. Who the hell asked for this?! 7. Fourth-wall breaking commentary... You have DC asking the player with the controller to "stop going for takedowns and mash some buttons instead". 8. Selectable celebrations at the end. Again, who asked for this?! 9. A very "arcadey" UI in general - so many bright colours. Doesn't look professional at all. \-- Really not a fan of the direction the game has taken and will for sure lose a few hardcore MMA fans who lean towards a simulation. I'm also not sure this game will attract the type of demographic it's clearly geared towards considering it's completely different in game design to Tekken, Street Fighter and Mortal Kombat. I'm also not sure it will attract the kids they're after considering it's an 18 game. Bit confused and disappointed. If I want to play an arcade fighter, I load up my MK11 and not UFC 3 ffs.
I hate the fact that he breaks the fourth-wall.
"Create-A-Fighter" - Custom fighters that you can create.
Herb: "Fighter, are you ready?" McGregor: Blow kiss to crowd.
At some stage while playing, I hear him saying to the player to stop going for takedowns and "mash some buttons" instead. A minor thing, but it ruins the experience for me slightly.
Don't buy, you'll just get scammed.
This one actually made me spit my drink out a little.
All you literally have to do is time a side step to the left or right when he throws a side kick. Then it's a free knock down if you land two shots.
It plays a massive part on the ground that's for sure. If the connection isn't anything other than green bars then you will need to either guess or see in to the future to denial properly.
No Dennis Bermudez :(
Sim.
But a lion mask isn't?
Are we going to address the hit-detection on that one or not? Hooker damn well knocked him out with the force.
Show us the full three round scorecards then we can make a decision. If your two knockdowns and control time came in one round, I'm sorry buddy but that isn't enough to win a fight.
Better enjoy that while it lasts to be honest.

The trailer for Career Mode made it seem like there would be an actual side-storyline with you and the coach. However, watching a few career mode playthroughs on YouTube, the dialogue literally comes at the start and then vanishes...
Commentary is the last of my worries. For UFC 3, I turned that shit off to concentrate on the fight. I'll be doing the same for UFC 4.
Totally agree. I will be getting the game, but not at launch. In my opinion, it's not worth #163;45 (or the Euro/USD equivalent).
She wears a t-shirt in the octagon in real life.
It'll be around as long as EA keeps online switched on, which knowing EA won't be for too long if it has an effect on UFC 4.
I hope the same energy is kept for all CAFs that offend demographics. Not just jews.
I'm still playing UFC 3. I will only purchase UFC 4 when the game's price goes down and it's out of its current paid beta (oh sorry..), "full release" stage.

His actions had a profound effect on the Jewish community (and population) and will therefore offend them most. There are also other types of CAFs that can be made which will offend blacks, Asians, East-Asian and even whites. I just want to see the same type of banning applied. I saw way too many offensive CAFs in UFC 3 that seemingly went unpunished.
Agreed.

WRITING.TITLE: Making the clinch undeniable in this game was a big mistake.
WRITING.TEXT: In the next patch, they need to insert some sort of input to deny it. Sways, keeping distance and intercepting with strikes only works for a certain amount of time. If a clinch spammer wants you in the clinch to spam knees and standing guillotine, by hook or by crook he'll get you. So then naturally, you'll want to fight fire with fire and the game then becomes a clinchfest. It was a big mistake to make this mechanic undeniable.
The belt's not even in Dana hand while waiting for the winner to be announced. It then suddenly pops out of thin air to wrap around the fighters waist.
As I said, by hook or by crook, they'll get you.
I literally started watching MMA and took a serious interest and following of it because of the game. Ah the nostalgia. What a shame MMA has ended up in EA's hands.

WRITING.TITLE: Reach A safety rating now can't find a ranked race?
WRITING.TEXT: In short. Reached A Safety Rating and now I cannot for the life of me find an ranked lobby. It seems to match make, it uses a combination of both your Skill Rating (current Silver) and your Safety Rating. So my combination must not be one with a lot of racers, if at all none. So it looks like the next race I find myself in, I'll have to deliberately cut all corners to get my Safety Rating back down to at least B which I found lobbies in. Anyone else have this issue?
Oh really? That's a shame. 2020 is my first F1 game since 2014 so thanks for the heads up.
Agreed. Sad state of affairs.
